pullRequest.body:
This matches `Set.inclusion`, `Subring.inclusion`, `Subalgebra.inclusion`, etc.

Also renames the `homOfLe` spellings in `Algebra/Lie` to match.

Note that we leave `LieSubalgebra.ofLe`, as this is a completely different statement!

As requested by @alreadydone.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: I think the usual way to do [LieSubalgebra.ofLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Lie/Subalgebra.html#LieSubalgebra.ofLe) is `K.comap K'.val` where you don't need the Le assumption.

> I think the usual way to do [LieSubalgebra.ofLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Lie/Subalgebra.html#LieSubalgebra.ofLe) is `K.comap K'.val` where you don't need the Le assumption.

Yep, I see that we even have `LieSubalgebra.ofLe_eq_comap_incl` so we really should nuke `LieSubalgebra.ofLe` at some point (but keep this lemma, restated appropriately).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Sorry @alreadydone, I didn't see those comments in time. At any rate, this was mostly just a find and replace, so I didn't make any attempt to clean up (or even look at!) any surrounding code, unless it broke
Yeah I understand, and the cleanups weren't important enough for me to abort the merge.

Thanks!

bors merge
Thanks!

Thanks!

bors merge
Thanks!
I note that the new name picks up `of_le` for different reasons than the old.

Hmm, first time seeing this   
Apparently it's https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/05ad6c6d5e122ac4f6b3929b49039a0c1a646bab/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Basic.lean#L245

```suggestion
    map p'.subtype (range <| inclusion h) = p := by simp [range_inclusion, map_comap_eq, h]
```

```suggestion
  __ := Submodule.inclusion h
```
(untested)
same here

```suggestion
def inclusion : K R K' where
  __ := Submodule.inclusion h
  map_lie' {_ _} := rfl
```
since you changed the others (untested)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: rename `Submodule.ofLe` to `Submodule.inclusion`

nodes.body: I think the usual way to do [LieSubalgebra.ofLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Lie/Subalgebra.html#LieSubalgebra.ofLe) is `K.comap K'.val` where you don't need the Le assumption.

> I think the usual way to do [LieSubalgebra.ofLe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Lie/Subalgebra.html#LieSubalgebra.ofLe) is `K.comap K'.val` where you don't need the Le assumption.

Yep, I see that we even have `LieSubalgebra.ofLe_eq_comap_incl` so we really should nuke `LieSubalgebra.ofLe` at some point (but keep this lemma, restated appropriately).

Thanks!
